intro: Chaetogastra cistoides, commonly known as the bladder cist, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Polygonaceae. It is characterized by its erect, herbaceous stems and simple, alternate leaves that are often hairy. The plant produces small, clustered flowers with five petals, typically in shades of pink or purple. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows and woodland edges. Due to its unique morphology and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
